alert.note: Alert for Plumas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 21 at 2:01PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE ALONG LITTLE LAST CHANCE CREEK NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM PDT FRIDAY APRIL 28TH... * WHAT...Very high flows along Little Last Chance Creek due to an upstream dam release at Frenchman Dam and increased snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of northeast California along Little Last Chance Creek downstream of Frenchman Dam in Plumas County. * WHEN...Until 330 PM PDT Friday Apr 28. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and nearing Highway 70. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM PDT, Flooding will result in the advisory area from an upstream dam floodgate release. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chilcoot-Vinton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
